thread.title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens poster revealed by Disney

author: Michael Idato
title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens poster revealed by Disney
text:

Star Wars: The Force Awakens - Comic-Con reel Direct from San Diego Comic-Con, here’s an extra special look behind the scenes of The Force Awakens…
PT3M31S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-3z454 620 349 July 11, 2015 Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings The US studio giant Disney has unveiled the official poster for the upcoming film Star Wars: The Force Awakens .
The poster, which was released via the studio's social media channels, features original trilogy heroes Han Solo (Harrison Ford) and Princess Leia (Carrie Fisher), as well as new characters Finn (John Boyega), Poe Dameron (Oscar Issac) and Rey (Daisy Ridley).
It also features glimpses of the film's new villains, Kylo Ren (Adam Driver) and Captain Phasma (Gwendolyn Christie).
Star wars releases its new look. 
On the poster, Finn is wielding a blue lightsaber, the weapon of the heroic Jedi knights, who once defended the Old Republic but were swept away by the rise of the Empire.
Advertisement The studio also confirmed a new trailer would be aired on US television during Monday night's football game between the New York Giants and the Philadelphia Eagles. Monday Night Football airs on ESPN, a sports channel owned by Disney. The trailer is scheduled to air Tuesday, Sydney time.
The new film, which continues three decades after the sixth Star Wars film, Return of the Jedi, features the galaxy in conflict, as the rebel alliance (now known as the resistance) clashes with a resurgent Imperial offshoot, the so-called First Order.
The studio also announced advance ticket sales for the film would open Monday, US time. It is not released in US cinemas until December 18, however a spike in early ticket sales is expected to confirm what most analysts already suspect: the film will break box office records when it is released.
Check out the new official poster! Tune in to @ESPN ’s Monday Night Football for a new look at #TheForceAwakens . pic.twitter.com/NTRWLlVyID 
— Star Wars (@starwars) October 18, 2015
